description.narrative: Katakwi district is located in eastern Uganda and is one of the poorest districts in the country. The district is prone to regular flooding, water logging, and prolonged dry spell which undermine peoples? capacity to enjoy their rights to meaningful liveli hoods. FCA has been active in this region supporting DRR related activities. This project is expected to build on the lessons learnt with the aim of scaling up the interventions in DRR targeting DRR committees at various levels. The project objectives are: ? To strengthen the functionality of DRR committees from district to village levels to prevent and mitigate the effects and impact of water logging and dry spells? To enhance practices and methods that promote community resilience to water logging and dry spellsActivities: ? Conduct training of DRR Committees members ? Conduct training of District and Sub county DRR teams on DRR information management? Conduct training of Sub county DRR committees? Conduct awareness raising sessions on early warning signs/s ignals? Map out communities prone to hazards? Support communities to develop community action plans? Facilitate quarterly coordination and review meetings ? Conduct demonstrations on practices and methods that enhance community resilience to these disaster ? Promote village saving and loan associations (VSLA) ? Construction of underground water harvesting tanks Rights-holders /beneficiaries: DRR committees and 1200 targeted households in 20 villages. Implementing partner:Lutheran World Federation Uganda - LWF (Katakwi Sub-Programme). LWF and FCA have a long partnership in the area and LWF has expertise in DRR.
